pullRequest.body:
This PR creates a new file with the machinery for transferring matroid structures between types. The most important definitions are `Matroid.map`, which pushes a `M : Matroid α` along `f : α → β` to give an `N : Matroid β`, and
`Matroid.comap`,  which pulls `N : Matroid β` back along `f : α → β` to get an `M : Matroid α`. The former requires `f` to be injective on the ground set of `M`, but the latter doesn't. 

The original decision to define matroids with an embedded ground set within a type rather than just a structure on a type came with tradeoffs, and it is in places like this that they show up the most. For this reason, the file also defines several variants of `map` where the range/domain of the function in question is a coerced set rather than a type. 

There is nothing mathematically interesting going on with these definitions, and maps and comaps are not central to matroid theory in actual research, but they are very useful in making formalization painless, as they save the work of painstakingly checking matroid axioms in many cases. They will be used in future PRs to define things like direct sums and linearly representable matroids. 

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

`+ instance [M.Finitary] {f : α ↪ β} : (M.mapEmbedding f).Finitary`
`+ instance [M.Finitary] {f : α ≃ β} : (M.mapEquiv f).Finitary`
`+ instance [M.FiniteRk] {X : Set α} : (M.restrictSubtype X).FiniteRk := by`

`+ instance [M.Finite] {f : α ≃ β} : (M.mapEquiv f).Finite`
`+ instance [M.Nonempty] : (M.restrictSubtype M.E).Nonempty`
`+ instance [M.Nonempty] {f : α → β} (hf) : (M.map f hf).Nonempty`
`+ instance [M.Nonempty] {f : α ↪ β} : (M.mapEmbedding f).Nonempty`
`+ instance [M.Nonempty] {f : α ≃ β} : (M.mapEquiv f).Nonempty`
`+ instance [M.RkPos] : (M.restrictSubtype M.E).RkPos := by`
`+ instance [M.RkPos] {f : α → β} (hf) : (M.map f hf).RkPos`
`+ instance [M.RkPos] {f : α ↪ β} : (M.mapEmbedding f).RkPos`
`+ instance [M.RkPos] {f : α ≃ β} : (M.mapEquiv f).RkPos`

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9684437236/job/26722213552)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9684437236/job/26722214432)

Some minor questions.
Once you have `comap` up and running, the rest is very clean! Looks like a great design.

bors d+

Some minor questions.
Once you have `comap` up and running, the rest is very clean! Looks like a great design.

bors d+

**[lint-bib]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion @Misc{ aignerhorev2012infinite, author = {Elad Aigner-Horev and Johannes Carmesin and Jan-Oliver Fröhlich}, ```

**[lint-bib]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion archiveprefix = {arXiv} ```

**[lint-bib]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion archiveprefix = {arXiv} ```
If the matroid `N` is only used for this lemma in section `restrictSubtype`, wouldn't it be better to declare the variable here?

```suggestion
and unions do not exist for some pairs of infinite matroids: see [aignerhorev2012infinite].
```

```suggestion
[aignerhorev2012infinite] : E. Aigner-Horev, J. Carmesin, J. Fröhlic, Infinite Matroid Union, arXiv:1111.0602 [math.CO]
```
Do "Perfect (1969)" and "Oxley, ..." deserve entries in the `.bib` file?
I guess you could have a `mapFinite` or something like that. But maybe that's too many variants?
I have a student working on this at the moment. It has quite a different flavour from what is currently here, since it actually has some mathematical content. I'll put it as a todo.

Can't you use constructor notation, like
```suggestion
  { E := f ⁻¹' N.E
    Indep := fun I ↦ N.Indep (f '' I) ∧ InjOn f I
    indep_empty := by simp
    indep_subset := fun I J h hIJ ↦ ⟨h.1.subset (image_subset _ hIJ), InjOn.mono hIJ h.2⟩
```
etc...

**[lint-bib]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```

**[lint-bib]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion @Article{ phillips1940, ```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Matroid/Map): maps between matroids
